Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrew's Roma n Catholic Church, Cardnal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y. 10007.

Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 20, 2006 and January 3, 2007 be adopted and printed by Council Member Foster.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Foster moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 20, 2006 and the Charter Meeting of January 3, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 060105 ZSM and C 060106 ZSM, and shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application nos. N 060103 ZRY and C 060104 ZMM that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, W. 60th Street, Manhattan (C060105ZSM)

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the probation of professional engineers and registered architects.

Items.MatterName: Probation of professional engineers and registered architects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sanctioning professional engineers and registered architects who knowingly or negligently professionally certify a false or noncompliant building permit application or plans.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a database of professional engineers and architects who self-certify false or noncompliant building permit applications or plans.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use

Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 060310 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3 to facilitate a mixed use development in the Ladies Mile Historic District. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.AgendaNote: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.70(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter. to the City Planning Commission
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 23rd Street Development LLC, Manhattan (C060310ZSM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for surviving family members of deceased uniformed correctional and sanitation employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for surviving family members of deceased uniformed correctional and sanitation employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming six thoroughfares and public places, Hillside Avenue, Borough of Queens, Douglas Road, Borough of Queens, Little Neck Road, Borough of Queens, Cherry Street, Borough of Queens, Willow Street, Borough of Queens, Boulevard, Borough of Queens and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Name Changes, Renaming six thoroughfares and public places

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to domestic partnerships.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Domestic Partnerships

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.638, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from former owner Enola Walker, deceased, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1902, Lot No. 126 on the tax map for the borough of Manhattan”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclosure, Enola Walker, Manhattan Block No.  1902, Lot No. 126 (A.638).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.693, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to stopping at exits of parking garages in cities with a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Vehicle and traffic law, stopping at exits of parking garages (A.693).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.639, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to Debora Unger and Anthony Marcus, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 2074, Lot No. 15 and Block No. 1949, Lot No. 5 on the tax map for the borough of Manhattan”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclosure, Debora Unger and Anthony Marcus, Manhattan Block No. 2074, Lot No. 15 and Block No. 1949 Lot No. 5 (A.639).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.625, “AN ACT to amend the parks, recreation and historic preservation law, in relation to vacating a trust”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Parks, recreation and historic preservation law, vacating a trust (A.625).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.753, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of commercial bicyclists”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Regulation of commercial bicyclists (A.753).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.1052, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for building code violations”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Penalties for building code violations (A.1052).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon sponsors of New York Fashion Week to adopt a healthy models awareness education campaign and to ban models with a body mass index of lower than 18.5 from walking the Fashion Week runways.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Sponsors of NY Fashion Week to adopt a healthy models awareness education campaign and to ban models with a body mass index of lower than 18.5 from walking the Fashion Week runways.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Council of the City of New York to declare a symbolic moratorium on the use of the “N” word in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declare a symbolic moratorium on the use of the “N” word in NYC during the month of February, also known as Black History Month.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the contents of a lobbyist’s statement of registration, and to repeal subdivision (g) of section 3-213 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the mailing of forms by the city clerk.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Contents of a lobbyist’s statement of registration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designated geographic areas of commuter vans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Designated geographic areas of commuter vans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the New York City Department of Education to provide additional rides on Student Metrocards or Supplemental Student Metrocards, and to extend the valid time limits of such cards in order to enable students to participate in school-related and after-school activities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: MTA and the NYC Department of Education to provide additional rides on Student Metrocards or Supplemental Student Metrocards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the preliminary mayor’s management report and the mayor’s management report to contain detailed information regarding the issuance of parking placards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the preliminary MMR and the MMR to contain detailed information regarding the issuance of parking placards.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a comprehensive wetlands protection strategy for New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creation of a comprehensive wetlands protection policy for NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to workplace injury reporting requirements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Workplace injury reporting requirements.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the Director of the Mayor’s Office of Veterans’ Affairs to send annual written notice to all veterans within New York City informing them of federal, State and City benefits to which veterans and their families are entitled.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Director of the Mayor’s Office of Veterans’ Affairs to send annual written notice to all veterans within NYC informing them of federal, State and City benefits to which veterans and their families are entitled.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the Mayor’s Office of Film, Theatre and Broadcasting notify and obtain input from the local Community Board and Council Member when restricting parking for more than 24 hours.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Requiring that the Mayor’s Office of Film, Theatre and Broadcasting notify and obtain input from the local Community Board and Council Member when restricting parking for more than 24 hours.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all diesel fuel storage tanks located inside of buildings above the lowest floor and on rooftops and building setbacks be completely encased to provide added safety.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all diesel fuel storage tanks located inside of buildings above the lowest floor and on rooftops and building setbacks be completely encased to provide added safety.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Pension Boards of New York City and New York State’s various pensions to divest the City and State of any investments made in corporations doing business with Sudan until the genocide in Darfur ends.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Pension Boards of NYC and NYS’s various pensions to divest the City and State of any investments made in corporations doing business with Sudan until the genocide in Darfur ends.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing notice to the state concerning disciplinary proceedings against certain professionals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Providing notice to the state concerning disciplinary proceedings against certain professionals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would authorize the City of New York to adopt local laws to amend the Unincorporated Business Tax, the General Corporation Tax, and the Banking Corporation Tax to give tax credits to employers that hire qualified formerly incarcerated persons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: NYC to adopt local laws to amend the Unincorporated Business Tax, the General Corporation Tax, and the Banking Corporation Tax to give tax credits to employers that hire qualified formerly incarcerated persons.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Public Service Commission to reject Con Edison’s Proposed M29 Transmission Line and Academy Substation Project and adopt the alternate route for the M29 Plan proposed by the Bronx, Manhattan, Yonkers M29 Joint Monitoring Committee.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: NYS Public Service Commission to reject Con Edison’s Proposed M29 Transmission Line and Academy Substation Project.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the commissioner of the department of transportation enforce the speed limits in the vessel regulation zone and the no wake zone by means of a photo violation-monitoring device.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring that the commissioner of the DOT enforce the speed limits in the vessel regulation zone and the no wake zone by means of a photo violation-monitoring device.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all persons complete an approved boating safety training course before being permitted to operate small vessels in the waters around the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all persons complete an approved boating safety training course before being permitted to operate small vessels in the waters around NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Government of Bangladesh to drop sedition charges against Salah Uddin Shoaib Choudhury.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Government of Bangladesh to drop sedition charges against Salah Uddin Shoaib Choudhury.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing and honoring Nancy Pelosi for her contributions to the advancement of women in politics and society at large, and on her election as the first woman in United States history to Speaker of the United States House of Representatives.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Recognizing and honoring Nancy Pelosi for her contributions to the advancement of women in politics and society at large.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including in the nuisance abatement law certain violations of the penal law and the alcoholic beverage control law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Including in the nuisance abatement law certain violations of the penal law and the alcoholic beverage control law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports concerning the discharge of firearms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to submit reports concerning the discharge of firearms to the council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of artificial trans fats by food service establishments and mobile food unit commissaries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of artificial trans fats by food service establishments and mobile food unit commissaries.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing New York City’s volunteer ambulance companies to purchase gasoline or diesel fuel, for their ambulances, directly from the New York City Fire Department or New York City Police Department.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Allowing NYC’s volunteer ambulance companies to purchase gasoline or diesel fuel, for their ambulances, directly from the FDNY or NYPD.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing penalties for construction-related violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Increasing penalties for construction-related violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the process for a permit for a major alteration.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Process for a permit for a major alteration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating self-certification of plans submitted to the department of buildings regarding demolitions and certain alterations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Eliminating self-certification of plans submitted to the department of buildings regarding demolitions and certain alterations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to allocate unlimited-use MetroCards to non-municipal first responders in order to allow them quick and easy access to the subway system in the event of an emergency.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to allocate unlimited-use MetroCards to non-municipal first responders.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
